messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Ko Katchushi/Myochin?
messages.msgSnippet: Pete, Alan and all. From my understanding, there is a relationship in the pre Edo work between Tosho, Katchushi and Myochin that crosses over and can blur the
messages.messageBody:
Pete, Alan and all. From my understanding, there is a relationship in
the pre Edo work between Tosho, Katchushi and Myochin that crosses over
and can blur the lines of separation for these 3 groups. There is a
theory that the Myochin family was the creator of Katchushi but in
reading Torigoye/Haynes they state there is no real evidence for this.
The iron is also stated to be better quality in the Katchushi/Myochin
tsuba than in Tosho so maybe here is something in there that the NBTHK
saw that we cannot see in the photo's ?

The similarities that this guard has with Tosho though are too close for
me the fathom the reason it is called Myochin. I think Jim is away in
the swamp again so he may not answer. Perhaps Gordon is here and can
shed some light maybe ?. mate ???.

good question.

Rich

> Pete

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Ko Katchushi/Myochin?

Pete,
It must be the matal, it sure looks like Katchu-shi.
Alan

From: klepet33319
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, June 17, 2006 3:14 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Ko Katchushi/Myochin?


http://page.auctions.yahoo.co.jp/jp/auction/90318701

I am curious why this is papered to Myochin as opposed to Katchushi (or
Tosho for that matter). I would suppose it has to do with the metal
which of course will make it difficult to tell from scans. Any help
appreciated.
Pete
